column2: S/he is in charge of the physical, mental and emotional well-being of the children under her care. She must possess the ability to teach his/her subject in order to achieve the learning outcomes.             Responsibilities and Duties         S/he must:       Possess thorough knowledge of his/her subject and the curriculum adopted by the school       Possess in-depth knowledge of project-based learning methodology       Motivate, stimulate and encourage experiential learning       Employ appropriate techniques and strategies for instruction and evaluation       Ensure age-appropriate indoor and outdoor activities to aid learning       Focus on skill development       Possess the ability to identify learning disabilities       Develop appropriate learning aids, tools and resources and come up with innovative ideas in the implementation of the curriculum       Maintain the record of competence, performance, and progress of every child and be able to handle parents.       Update herself/himself on the best practices       - At times have to participate in and take responsibility for school activities on or outside the campus.                       Requirements          Qualification: As per CBSE Norms       Experience: 3 years and above                 Skills:         Communication skills       Interpersonal skills       Organisational skills       Motivational skills

column2: A minimum of 5 years of teaching experience of the IGCSE and IB Biology Curriculum is a pre-requisite for this position.          We are looking for teachers who can develop the curriculum to create engaging lessons and active learning environment.          Who have hands on laboratory experience of a range of investigations.          Who have expertise in supervising student s experimental investigations.          Who can nurture students through different teaching methodologies.          Design & Administer Cambridge Exams    :        Liaise with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders, including students, parents, teachers, and administration.          Be aware of examination changes each academic year.          Manage Invigilators. This includes training new invigilators and updating existing invigilators on rules and regulation changes on an annual basis.          Update examination related policies.          Manage the examination entry process, including gathering information from teaching staff to ensure that students examination entries are made correctly and on time, making amendments/withdrawals etc.          Manage the examination preparation process. This includes examination timetables for students and staff; creating seating plans for each examination room; briefing candidates, staff, and parents; receiving, checking and securely storing confidential examination materials; administering internal assessment etc.          Manage examination days in accordance with awarding body regulations, including preparing for each exam day, starting an examination, dealing with emergencies, irregularities, and malpractice, ending the examination, collecting the examination scripts and packing and dispatching examination scripts.          Manage examination results. This includes accessing results electronically/downloading results from awarding body secure sites and preparing for results to be disseminated to each student/candidate.          Issuing examination certificates.

column2: Skoolfi is looking for PGT (Biology)-Male to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As a PGT Biology teacher, you will be entrusted with the responsibility of imparting knowledge and fostering an understanding of biological concepts and principles among students      Your role involves designing and delivering engaging lessons, conducting laboratory experiments, and facilitating discussions to promote inquiry-based learning and critical thinking in the field of biology      You will play a vital role in preparing students for academic assessments, as well as nurturing their curiosity, appreciation for the natural world, and scientific inquiry skills        Key Responsibilities:        Curriculum Development: Develop comprehensive lesson plans, instructional materials, and assessments aligned with curriculum standards and educational objectives in biology      Classroom Instruction: Deliver engaging and interactive lectures, demonstrations, and discussions to enhance students' understanding of biological concepts, processes, and phenomena      Laboratory Experiments: Plan and conduct laboratory experiments and investigations to provide hands-on learning experiences and reinforce theoretical concepts in biology      Ensure laboratory safety protocols are followed at all times      Student Assessment: Design and administer formative and summative assessments, including tests, quizzes, projects, and laboratory reports, to evaluate student learning outcomes and progress      Individualized Support: Provide individualized support, guidance, and feedback to students to address their learning needs, strengths, and areas for improvement in biology      Integration of Technology: Incorporate educational technology, multimedia resources, and digital tools to enhance teaching and learning experiences in biology, including virtual labs, simulations, and online resources      Field Trips and Outdoor Activities: Organize and lead field trips, nature walks, and outdoor activities related to biology to provide real-world contexts for learning and connect students with the natural environment      Collaboration: Collaborate with colleagues, administrators, and stakeholders to coordinate interdisciplinary projects, share best practices, and participate in professional development activities to enhance teaching effectiveness and student learning outcomes      Extracurricular Involvement: Engage students in extracurricular activities related to biology, such as science fairs, nature clubs, environmental initiatives, and wildlife conservation projects
